revised_title: Magnetic Field Line Reconnection: A New Mechanism and Its Implications
tldr: This article presents new solutions for the incompressible case of magnetic field line reconnection, which is a process that occurs when two regions of opposing magnetic fields come into contact. The solutions provide a more accurate understanding of the reconnection process and its implications for astrophysical and space plasmas. The research puts Petschek's mechanism on a solid mathematical foundation and shows that the discontinuities are not straight but curve away from the incoming flows. The maximum reconnection rate depends weakly on the magnetic Reynolds number and decreases as the inflow Alfven Mach number increases.
